channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping of household goods and waste, 10th July
item.description:
Fly tipping of household furniture left on street for multiple weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Crystal Palace Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drug paraphernalia Lisson St Gardens, 10th July
item.description:
Drug paraphernalia and refuse associated with it remains in Lisson Street Gardens aka the green Spine. Reported earlier this week, refuse now expanding to all over this area. Wooden casement under the slide in the children’s play area has become a drug dealers hub, with both dealers and drug takers gathering from far and wide. This was happening at 06:30 hours this morning, but it’s all the through the day and night. Can this be passed to Adam Hug’s office as it’s a blight on the area and feels totally unsafe. It’s as if the council deliberately turned a once lovely gardens with a park keeper into an anti social crime-filled open space on purpose.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55-56, Penfold Street, St. John's Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign, 10th July
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 10th July
item.description:
Mattresses, lots of cardboard and old fridges littered throughout the pathway. Along with litter scattered through out the pathway, encouraging foxes and rats. There is broken glass directly outside the entrance to my home, making it dangerous for my children to leave.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 184, Shooters Hill Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Pothole opposite shelter perry street bustop, 10th July
item.description:
Road has been cracking and deteriorating on the side of Parkside Avenue near perry street bus stops. This has resulted in a sizeable pothole opposite the sheltered perry street bustop in the carriageway. Cars may be ok, but bikes could suffer. Due to location pedestrians may suffer too if crossing

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Erith A206 blocked & has been coned off for weeks !!, 10th July
item.description:
Erith through to Slades Green & Crayford. The A 206 Queens Road, Northend Road & Thames Road are constantly restricted with cones.Yet, where are the work repair teams ? Walnut Tree Road has now been closed to traffic. This too is causing unnesssary delays & inconvenience to the local residents.Please contact the contractors & request them to speed up the repair works & to remove the ugly blight of road cones in this area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
